"Ilan is an extremely qualified individual, he has the necessary experience for this position, he has served various governments and international organizations. He does not represent a political faction, and that is very positive," Meirelles told Folha.

Meirelles also said he disagreed with the attempt by Lula's team to bar Goldfajn's appointment to the command of the IDB.

"He is an impartial technician, who has all the conditions to work with the Lula government and greatly benefit Brazil, which has never commanded the IDB," he added.
